moves.1. e4: I seen that and thought he's probably going to try scholars mate
moves.1... c5: I did that just in case he tries D4
moves.2. Bc4: just as expected Bc4to attack the F7 square
moves.2... Nc6: so I brought my knight out so if he tried move Queen to F3 I would go Ne5 to attack both queen and bishop and protect the mating square
moves.3. Qh5: but instead moves his Queen to H5 and then try and mate me on the F7 square
moves.3... e6: I went to E6 to protect the C5 Pawn but also stop checkmate
moves.4. Nc3 Nf6: I then thought whilst his queen is out I would start attacking it
moves.5. Qf3 Ne5: I attack it with the other Knight
moves.6. Qd3: I was suprised with this as I thought he would probably move it to E2
moves.6... Nxd3+: I then took the Queen which then my opponent resigned
